channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: 4 dead animals on the area near the last bridge. Looks like 2 foxes and 2 deer. 1 deer has been there 3 weeks., 21st January
item.description:
I Deer has been there 3 weeks now. Now there is another one close by. And 2 foxes. There must be a broken fence near the last bridge on that road. My disabled child is getting quite upset at seeing them everyday.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree fallen onto No 5 Clarence Sq Cheltenham, 21st January
item.description:
A tree blown over before Christmas is still causing a problem. The fallen tree is blocking the pavement creating a hazard for pedestrians, particularly wheelchair users from the nearby National Star Centre. The balcony of the house the tree has fallen against is in a very precarious condition. If the tree or balcony were to fall further it could cause injury to neighbouring residents and/or pedestrians. Barriers have been erected, exacerbating the obstruction but no remedial work has been undertaken
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Clarence Square, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Tree causing damage/obstruction to pavement or road

item.title: Give way junction congestion, 21st January
item.description:
At the intersection of Lobleys Drive and Typhoon Way. Is there a reason why when traversing Lobleys Drive from the east the road requires you to give way? Considering the primary flow of traffic is directly down Lobleys Drive, you’re required to take a hard right turn in order to remain on the same street, which at rush hour causes unnecessary delays backing up to the traffic lights at Pioneer Avenue. Has the council considered adjusting the road markings allowing unobstructed access down Lobleys Drive? Or as a viable alternative, converting the junction to a mini roundabout? This issue has persisted for an indefinite period of time.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beamont Walk, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: Pothole across carriageway, 21st January
item.description:
Pothole on side of road of playing field. It’s across the entire one lane of the carriageway and seems to be getting worse. Almost at the end of the 30mph speed limit area
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Up Hatherley Way, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: Post or sign leaning slightly (less than 20 degrees) problem, 21st January
item.description:
Customer has called back in to ask if some further signs can can be taken away from the middle of the road. The PGRs have been removed but the customers thinks the 2 signs are still stopping HGVs from making the turning. Removing these signs may help with this as his property is still in jeopardy, Customer advised this is a Bromford Homes dwelling and they have advised they call us.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Post or sign leaning slightly (less than 20 degrees)
